results.title: The neuroprotective effect of statin in traumatic brain injury: A systematic review
results.text_hl: ...The effect of oral @<m>CHEMICAL_Simvastatin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D019821 @@@simvastatin@@@ 40 mg daily for 10 days in individuals with @DISEASE_Brain_Injuries_Traumatic @DISEASE_MESH:D000070642 @@@TBI@@@ was researched by Shafiee et al, revealing that administration of @<m>CHEMICAL_Simvastatin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D019821 @@@simvastatin@@@ had a substantial impact in enhancing Glasgow @<m>DISEASE_Coma</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D003128 @@@Coma@@@ Scale (GCS) score in severe @DISEASE_Brain_Injuries_Traumatic @DISEASE_MESH:D000070642 @@@TBI@@@ individuals.

citations.NLM: Susanto M, Pangihutan Siahaan AM, Wirjomartani BA, Setiawan H, Aryanti C, Michael. The neuroprotective effect of statin in traumatic brain injury: A systematic review World Neurosurg X. 2023 Jul;19():100211. PMID: 37251243

results.title: Simvastatin's effects on survival and outcome in traumatic braininjury patients: a comparative study.
results.text_hl: RESULTS: The Glasgow @<m>DISEASE_Coma</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D003128 @@@Coma@@@ Scale level at discharge was significantly higher in the @<m>CHEMICAL_Simvastatin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D019821 @@@simvastatin@@@ group.

citations.NLM: Naghibi T, Madani S, Mazloomzadeh S, Dobakhti F. Simvastatin's effects on survival and outcome in traumatic braininjury patients: a comparative study. Turk J Med Sci. 2016 Jan 5;46(1):1-5. PMID: 27511325

results.title: Evaluation of early administration of simvastatin in the prevention and treatment of delirium in critically ill patients undergoing mechanical ventilation (MoDUS): a randomised, double-blind, placebo-controlled trial.
results.text_hl: We randomly assigned @SPECIES_9606 @@@patients@@@ (1:1 ratio) to receive either @<m>CHEMICAL_Simvastatin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D019821 @@@simvastatin@@@ 80 mg or placebo daily for up to a maximum of 28 days, irrespective of @<m>DISEASE_Coma</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D003128 @@@coma@@@ or @DISEASE_Delirium @DISEASE_MESH:D003693 @@@delirium@@@ status.

citations.NLM: Page VJ, Casarin A, Ely EW, Zhao XB, McDowell C, Murphy L, McAuley DF. Evaluation of early administration of simvastatin in the prevention and treatment of delirium in critically ill patients undergoing mechanical ventilation (MoDUS): a randomised, double-blind, placebo-controlled trial. Lancet Respir Med. 2017 Sep;5(9):727-737. PMID: 28734823

results.title: Evaluating early administration of the hydroxymethylglutaryl-CoA reductase inhibitor simvastatin in the prevention and treatment of delirium in critically ill ventilated patients (MoDUS trial): study protocol for a randomized controlled trial
results.text_hl: The aim of the Modifying @DISEASE_Delirium @DISEASE_MESH:D003693 @@@Delirium@@@ Using @<m>CHEMICAL_Simvastatin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D019821 @@@Simvastatin@@@ (MoDUS) trial is to test the hypothesis that treatment with enteral or oral @<m>CHEMICAL_Simvastatin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D019821 @@@simvastatin@@@ (80 mg) will increase the number of @DISEASE_Delirium @DISEASE_MESH:D003693 @@@delirium@@@- and @<m>DISEASE_Coma</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D003128 @@@coma@@@-free days in ventilated ICU @SPECIES_9606 @@@patients@@@ up to 14 days.

citations.NLM: Casarin A, McAuley DF, Alce TM, Zhao X, Ely EW, Jackson JC, McDowell C, Agus A, Murphy L, Page VJ. Evaluating early administration of the hydroxymethylglutaryl-CoA reductase inhibitor simvastatin in the prevention and treatment of delirium in critically ill ventilated patients (MoDUS trial): study protocol for a randomized controlled trial Trials. 2015 May 16;16():218. PMID: 25982544
